III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On an unknown date in 2025, two youth had consensual sex at
the facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 08/29/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 08/26/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated she did not recall the date she
had sexual contact with Youth B, but it occurred when she
remained outside in the courtyard with Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth D and the other youths went back to Unit 2D. Youth A
stated Youth B said, “I want to eat your private part” to her while
they were outside and this made her uncomfortable. Youth A
stated she told Youth B that they should not have sexual contact
but when they returned to the unit Youth B slid under the second
shower door while she was inside showering. Youth A stated Staff
2 asked a question (does not recall what was asked) and Youth B
said, “I’m in the big shower” (first shower) and Staff 2 said, “Think
you play games” and did not say anything further. Youth A stated
Youth B remained fully clothed, pushed Youth A to lay down and
had oral contact with Youth A’s genitals. Youth A stated Youth B
slid out of the shower and she believes Youth B slid under the first
shower because she heard the water turn on. Youth A explained
that the shower doors lock from inside and outside when closed.
Youth B was interviewed on 08/26/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth B stated she and Youth A agreed to
take a shower together and Youth C and Youth D overheard this
conversation when they were in the outside courtyard. Youth B
stated during shower time Youth A came to the first shower door
and asked if Youth B was getting into the second shower with her.
Youth B stated she followed Youth A into the second shower and
they bathed each other. Youth B stated she left the second
shower without being seen by staff or youth.
2

Youth C was interviewed on 08/26/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth C stated Youth A and Youth B
discussed being together and showering together. Youth C stated
she saw Youth B slide under the second shower door while fully
clothed to join Youth A in the shower and did not see Youth B exit
the second shower. Youth C said, “It’s not my business” when
asked if she reported this incident. Youth C stated she did not
know the date of this incident, but it happened when Unit 2D went
to the outside courtyard and she remained outside with Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth D while the other youths went back to the unit.
Youth C stated Staff 2 facilitated showers when Youth A and
Youth B were in the second shower together.
Youth D was interviewed on 08/26/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth D stated she knows Youth A and Youth
B and denied any knowledge or involvement in a shower incident
or sexual incident between Youth A and Youth B.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 09/17/2025 by phone. Staff 1 stated
she was previously interviewed by Wayne County Juvenile
Detention Special Investigation Unit Investigator and familiar with
the allegation in this investigation. Staff 1 stated she provided
break coverage for Staff 2 and Staff 3 on Unit 2D. Staff 1 stated
she remained outside with four youths (does not recall who) when
the other youths returned to the unit and brought the four youths
back to the unit for shower time. Staff 1 stated she sat in the unit’s
common area and monitored the youths, Staff 2 facilitated
showers, and Staff 3 was on break during shower time. Staff 1
stated she is unaware of Youth B entering Youth A’s shower.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 09/02/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 2 stated she is unaware of a shower incident
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 2 stated during shower time
youths are seated in the common area if not preparing for
showers. Staff 2 stated a staff is positioned to monitor the showers
and another staff is positioned by the staff desk area to monitor
the other youths during shower time.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 09/22/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
she heard about Youth A and Youth B being in the shower
together and does not believe she was on the unit when this
occurred. Staff 3 stated during shower time youths are to be
seated in the common area and phone calls are not permitted.
Staff 3 stated a staff is positioned in line of sight of the two
showers and the other staff is positioned on the other side of the
common area to maintain line of sight of the other youths.
3

Video
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 video footage starting at 6:34 PM shows
shower 1 and shower 2 with towels and clothes hanging on the
closed shower doors. Staff 2 unlocks shower 1 around 6:42 PM
and a youth exits. Youth B starts to hang her towel and clothes on
shower door 1. Staff 1 leaves the shower area and heads to the
staff desk. Youth B leaves shower door 1 ajar, walks to the staff
desk, and talks with Staff 2. Several youths are also standing in
the staff desk area. Youth B walks back to the showers, closes
shower door 1, and slides under the gap of shower door 2 around
6:43 PM. During this time, Staff 2 retrieves a body wash jug from
the staff bathroom and walks to shower 1 and gets there when
Youth B is already inside of shower 2. Staff 2 raises the jug to the
top of shower door 1, which has an open area from the top of the
shower door to the door frame. Youth D walks up to Staff 2, takes
the body wash jug, and pours bodywash on to a washcloth. Youth
D bends down and places her hand with the washcloth under the
gap of shower door 1. Youth D stands up without the washcloth.
Staff 2 leans towards shower door 1, moves to shower door 2, and
moves back to shower door 1. Youth C approaches Youth D and
Staff 2 in the shower area. Youth C and Youth D engage Staff 2 in
conversation and they leave the shower area. Staff 2 places the
bodywash jug back in the staff bathroom around 6:45 PM. Youth
D walks to the showers, bends down at shower door 2, walks to
the staff desk, returns to shower 2 and walks back to the staff
desk area. Youth B slides out from under the gap of shower door
2 around 6:50 PM and sits down in a chair across from the
showers. Youth C talks with Staff 2 at the staff desk area. Youth D
approaches Youth B and they talk before Youth B gets up and
slides under the gap of shower door 1. Youth C and Youth D walk
to shower door 1 around 6:53 PM and talk before walking away.
Staff 2 talks with youths at the staff desk. Staff 2 opens shower
door 1 and Youth B exits around 6:59 PM. Staff 2 then opens
shower door 2 and Youth A exits. Staff 2 is not seen checking the
shower hallway or redirecting Youth C and Youth D to not enter
the shower hallway during Youth A and Youth B’s shower time.
Reviewed video footage angle does not capture the other staff
sitting in the common area. Video footage does not record sound.
Documentation
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 afternoon shift logbook entries relevant to this
allegation are listed below.
• Staff 2 and Staff 3 are assigned to Unit 2D on 08/10/2025.
• 4:58 PM 12 youths are in the outdoor courtyard.
• 5:14 PM Staff 1 provides coverage for Staff 2’s break.
4

• 5:29 PM 8 youths return to the unit and 4 youths remain
outside.
• 5:50 PM Showers start and 4 youths return to the unit.
• 6:00 PM Showers remain in progress. “All in LOS” (line of
sight) is written.
• 7:30 PM Supervisor on unit for rounds.
• 9:00 PM Youths step down for bedtime.
• There is a documentation gap between 6:00 PM and 7:30
PM and from 7:30 PM to 9:00 PM.
• Logbook documentation does not include when Staff 2
returned from break, when Staff 3 left and returned from
break and when Staff 1 left the unit.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Youth Movement and
Supervision policy and procedure 10.25 defines line of sight as
“Coordinating all activities of the residents under staff supervision
so that visual contact is maintained and the actions of the
residents are known at all times.” The policy and procedure states
staff “…position themselves in a manner that maximizes the
opportunities for observation.” Line of sight is covered in Safety
and Security training.
Personnel Files were reviewed and noted:
• Staff 1 completed Safety and Security Training on
09/25/2024 and 09/26/2024.
• Staff 2 completed Safety and Security Training on
07/01/2025 and 07/07/2025.
• Staff 3 completed Safety and Security Training on
05/05/2025 and 05/06/2025.
• Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 do not have discipline history.
Layout of Incident Area
Upon entering Unit 2D there are two showers located to the left. A
short hallway runs parallel between the shower doors and a side
wall of an office. The staff desk area is comprised of two parallel
counters with entrances to an office and staff bathroom between
the two counters. One counter stems from the short hallway wall,
which is the outside office wall and the other counter stems from
the outside staff bathroom wall. The common area is across from
the staff desk with tables and seating.
This allegation was forwarded to law enforcement by Wayne
County Juvenile Detention Special Investigation Unit Investigator.
5

Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in providing for the needs,
protection, and supervision when Youth B slid under the gap of
shower door 2 and was in the shower with Youth A on 08/10/2025.
CONSULTATION
During shower time on Unit 2D, staff must maintain line of sight of
the shower hallway to ensure a youth does not slide in or out from
the bottom gap of the shower door. The shower hallway is an
observational blind spot from the staff desk area and common
area.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Rule Code & R 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety,
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Documentation
The following items are stated in Wayne County Juvenile
Detention’s Shower Procedure 16.4.
• Showers start at 7:00 PM. Supervisor must approve
showers to start at another time.
• Each youth has five minutes of showering time.
• Youths not showering are to be seated in the common
area.
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 logbook entries state showers started at 5:50
PM and showers remain in progress at 6:00 PM. Logbook does
not state when showers were completed and does not state
supervisory approval was obtained to start showers before 7:00
PM.
6

Video
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 video footage starting at 6:34 PM shows
shower 1 and shower 2 are occupied and youths are walking
about the unit.
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 video footage shows Youth A was in shower 2
around 6:34 PM and exited around 6:59 PM. Video also shows
Youth B was supposed to enter shower 1 around 6:43 PM and
exited shower 1 around 6:59 PM. Video does not show staff going
to the shower area to redirect Youth A and Youth B to complete
their showers timely.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance in following their Shower
Procedure 16.4 in the following areas.
• Unit 2D staff started youth showers before 7:00 PM on
08/10/2025 without documentation of supervisory approval
in the logbook.
• Shower time allotment exceeded five minutes for Youth A
and Youth B on 08/10/2025.
• Unit 2D youths were not seated in the common area during
shower time on 08/10/2025.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Documentation
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 afternoon shift logbook entries were reviewed.
Room checks were documented at 9:30 PM, 9:45 PM, 10:00 PM,
10:15 PM, 10:30 PM, 10:45 PM and 11:00 PM. Shift change
occurred at 11:00 PM.
Unit 2D 08/10/2025 room monitoring sheets were reviewed. It
shows room monitoring started sometime between 8:00 PM to
9:30 PM depending on the youth and ended at 7:00 AM on
08/11/2025. Every room monitoring sheet was documented in 15
minutes increments with the format of on the hour, quarter past
the hour, half past the hour and quarter to the hour.
7

Youth Movement and Supervision policy and procedure 10.25
states “Whenever residents are placed in a locked bedroom, they
shall be monitored on a frequent periodic basis to ensure safety
and appropriate behavior.” It states also states “During sleeping
hours (midnight shift), bedrooms shall be checked visually at
intermittent durations 15 minutes, not to exceed 15 minutes and
recorded in the pod logbook”.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for not completing or
documenting variable interval eye-on checks not to exceed 15
minutes on Unit 2D on 08/10/2025 to 08/11/2025 bedtime hours.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Youth Movement and Supervision policy and procedure 10.25
needs wording that states the visual eye-on checks are done in
variable durations not exceeding 15 minutes between each check.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
